facts.1: National Bikini Day marks the anniversary of the invention of the bikini by French designer Louis Réard in 1946.
facts.2: The bikini was named after the Bikini Atoll, where the United States conducted atomic tests, signifying its explosive impact on fashion.
facts.3: The original bikini was made of just 30 inches of fabric and was considered very revealing for its time.

facts.1: Venezuela Independence Day commemorates the country's independence from Spanish rule, which was declared on July 5, 1811.
facts.2: Venezuela was the first Spanish-American colony to declare independence.
facts.3: The independence of Venezuela was achieved under the leadership of Simón Bolívar, who is known as 'El Libertador' (The Liberator).

facts.1: Tynwald Day is the National Day of the Isle of Man, celebrating the island's Viking heritage and parliamentary tradition.
facts.2: On Tynwald Day, the laws enacted by the Isle of Man's parliament, Tynwald, are promulgated in both Manx and English.
facts.3: Tynwald is the oldest continuous parliament in the world, dating back to over 1000 years.
